programme.title: Sardine de l'espace
programme.sub-title: La machine à laver la cervelle

programme.title: Partir autrement en famille
programme.desc: Dominica - 3 Rivers & Rosalie Forest Ecolodge Mariloup Wolfe and her two sons witness the incredible resilience of a population that transformed the devastation of Hurricane Maria into a unique human and tourist adventure on the island of Dominica. Directed by: Yvonne Defour (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Objectif Monde L'hebdo
programme.desc:
Cursed by cobalt
A mineral essential for energy transition, but one mined under conditions that are far from being either ethical or sustainable: cobalt. In the Democratic Republic of Congo, home to the world's largest concentration of cobalt, thousands work in artisanal mines, despite the danger, just to feed their families. Report by Julien Fouchet, David Kalinga and Marielle Krouk for the France 2 magazine programme "Envoyé Special".
Guests: Julien Fouchet, France 2 journalist; Filipe Calvão, associate professor at the Geneva Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies, specialist in extractive economies and industries.
Presented by: Dominique Laresche.

programme.title: La course folle
programme.desc: The end's in sight Despite their fatigue everyone is determined to make the most of the season, right to the last minute, except for Olivier, who ends his two days early. For him, it's already time to recover the traps and head back home. Step by step, Agathe continues towards launching her tourism business. Directed by: Jean-François Fontaine (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: Destinations
programme.desc: Procida, Lamartine's island of love Between Naples and the imposing island of Ischia appeared Procida, discovered by Alphonse Lamartine in 1811. He found refuge there following a storm, aged 18. Volcanic rocks rising dramatically out of the sea, narrow streets clinging to the hillsides, luxuriant gardens behind age-old walls; the romantic young author was conquered.

programme.title: Mémoire trouble
programme.desc:
Garlat, retired police officer, finds himself confronting one of his former investigations as evidence from the past resurfaces and everything is called into question. Is the man he had convicted actually guilty? With his son, also a police officer, Garlat returns to Paris to reopen the investigation.

Directed by: Denis Malleval (France, 2021)

Screenplay by: Marie Guilmineau

Cast: Pierre Arditi (Pierre Garlat), Nicolas Grandhomme (Nicolas Garlat), Florence Muller (Florence Codogno), Clémence Boisnard (Amélie Perrot), Félix Kysyl (Thomas Sentier)

Genre: thriller

programme.title: Échappées belles
programme.desc: Welcome to Georgia Georgia, lying between Europe and Asia, is the smallest of the Black Sea countries. A veritable green lung with 87% of its surface taken up by mountains, their summits towering over 5,000 metres, we travel from the mild and luxuriant Black Sea coast to the deserts of its central plains. Presented by: Jérôme Pitorin. Directed by: Vincent Chaffard (season 15, France, 2021)

programme.title: La grande noirceur
programme.desc:
During a time of world war, Philippe, a Canadian deserter from Quebec, finds refuge in the American West. He survives by participating in Charlie Chaplin impersonation contests. His long journey becomes a voyage of initiation, as he discovers the dark side of the American dream both fascinating and violent.

Directed by: Maxime Giroux (Canada, 2018)

Cast: Martin Dubreuil, Romain Duris, Sarah Gadon, Reda Kateb

Genre: Drama

programme.title: L'art du crime
programme.desc:
Episode 2: The curse of Osiris

As she was assessing an ancient Egyptian box, a young woman becomes delirious and collapses, dead. Toxicological analyses reveal the presence of a powerful hallucinogen used by the Egyptian priests and the translation of the hieroglyphs on the box evokes a curse relating to Osiris, Egyptian god of the dead...

Directed by: Elsa Bennett, Hippolyte Dard (season 3, France, 2019)

Screenplay: Angèle Herry-Leclerc, Pierre-Yves Mora, Hélène Duchâteau, Julie-Anna Grignon, Christophe Joaquin

Cast: Nicolas Gob (Antoine Verlay), Éléonore Bernheim (Florence Chassagne), Dounia Coessens (Juliette Mariton), Clémentine Célarié (Nathalie Vallon), Samuel Labarthe (André Jaumard), Marc Arnaud (Champollion), Philippe Duclos (Pierre Chassagne), Benjamin Egner (Pardo), Emmanuel Noblet (Hugo Prieur), Farida Rahouadj (the psychoanalyst), Ambroise Sabbagh (Greg)

Genre: detective

programme.title: L'avenir nous appartient
programme.desc: Episode 5 The MP Émilise Lessard-Therrien is Quebec's first elected representative to take her baby into a parliamentary session. Guillaume Cantin has created the Transformerie, to reduce food waste. Brigitte Alepin is working for a fairer tax system; Sévrine Labelle, for the right to disconnect. Manon Jean expresses emotions using meteorological vocabulary. Directed by: Jean-François Poisson (Canada, 2021)

programme.title: Le dessous des cartes
programme.desc:
Romania: between East and West, on the threshold of the war
Member of NATO since 2004 and the European Union since 2077, Russia's invasion of Ukraine has made Romania a country of strategic importance. Outpost of western aid, fallback position for Ukrainian refugees and on the front line with Moldavia, Romania lives in fear of an extension of the war.
Presented by: Émilie Aubry.

programme.title: L'art a du chien, et du chat...
programme.desc:
Dogs and cats feature prominently in most museums and art galleries. But why do artists feel so inspired by them? What do these artworks reveal about the link that connects these domestic animals and mankind?

Directed by: Anka Schmid (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: TV5MONDE, le journal Afrique
programme.desc: All the African news from the TV5MONDE news staff.
